items: Pragmatics in Second Language Acquisition: From Theory to Practice (Wei Ren, Beihang University)

Regex in R for Multimodal Analysis (Christoph Rühlemann, Albert-Ludwigs-Universität Freiburg)
The maximum number of participants for each workshop is 20.
Participation fee (including coffee/tea breaks on both days and lunch on June 21:
You can register for a workshop in the course of the regular conference registration procedure.
Corpus pragmatics: Using corpus methods to study discursive and pragmatic phenomena
Philosophical pragmatics and the analysis of discourse
Regex in R for Multimodal Analysis
The workshop will cover these topics:
Convert (multimodal) transcripts to R data frames to make them machine
Analyze (multimodal) transcripts in R data frames
Export and structure ELAN annotations in R data frames
Analyze and visualize ELAN annotations in R data frames
Article submission (max. 16,000 characters including spaces, 4 pages): July 31, 2025
Feedback on the article and revisions by the editorial committee September 2025
Text revisions and final submission: December 31, 2025
Thank you for their support in 2025:
We are also open to other ideas.
Taguchi, Naoko (Ed.) (2019), The Routledge handbook of second language acquisition and pragmatics.
